definitions: Of the colour of milk or fresh snow, due to the reflection of all visible rays of light; the opposite of black.
(of a plant) having white flowers or pale-coloured fruit.
(of wine) made from white grapes, or dark grapes with the skins removed, and having a yellowish colour.
(of coffee or tea) served with milk or cream.
(of food such as bread or rice) light in colour as a result of a refining process.
Belonging to or denoting a human group having light-coloured skin (chiefly used of peoples of European extraction)
Reserved by law for those classified as white.
